wikipedia_page.main: Bashir Ahmad (12 February 1940 – 6 February 2009) was a successful businessman and a Scottish National Party politician. He made history when he was elected as a Member of the Scottish Parliament (MSP) for the Glasgow region at the 2007 election, as the first MSP to be elected from Scottish Asian, Muslim and non-native backgrounds.

response: * Anne McLaughlin replaced Bashir Ahmad. Ahmad died in February 2009 and McLaughlin was next on the Scottish National Party's list.
*Bashir Ahmad (1940–2009), first BAME person to be elected to the Scottish Parliament, emigrated from Pakistan to Govanhill in 1961
* Bashir Ahmad - first Asian Member of the Scottish Parliament (2007–09)
Bashir Ahmed or Bashir Ahmad may refer to:
*Mirza Bashir Ahmad (1893–1963), Religious scholar and writer
*Bashir Ahmad (mixed martial artist) (born 1982), Pakistani-American mixed martial artist
*Bashir Ahmad (Scottish politician) (1940–2009), Karachi-born Member of the Scottish Parliament
*Bashir Ahmad (camel driver) (c. 1913–1992), 'surprise' visitor to the U.S. White House
